snippet: After two decades of mocking the powerful as a columnist and screenwriter, Belal Fadl has been blacklisted, with no newspaper in Egypt willing to defy the government by hiring him.
abstract: Saturday Profile of popular Egyptian satirical columnist and screenwriter Belal Fadl, who has been blacklisted by news media since he published column ridiculing promotion of Gen Abdel Fattah el-Sisi to rank of field marshal; Fadl's irreverent style has inspired generation to voice its dissent more vividly than Egyptians dared during Pres Hosni Mubarak's rule.
lead_paragraph: After two decades of mocking the powerful as a columnist and screenwriter, Belal Fadl has been blacklisted, with no newspaper in Egypt willing to defy the government by hiring him.

headline.main: A Voice of Dissent in Egypt Is Muffled, but Not Silent
headline.print_headline: A Voice of Dissent in Egypt Is Muffled, but Not Silent
